title: Grading Computer Programming Skills using Machine Learning

author: Varun Aggarwal, Aspiring Minds Assessment Pvt. Ltd.

One is the machine learning.
Aspect of it in which we build a model to be able to predict how close a particular program is to the correct solution or the set of correct solutions.

The other aspect of this is the whole stylistic aspect in which we try to assess whether the program does well against the industry best practices, whether the code is modular, whether the variables have been named right so this is a totally different component that we look for.

Empirically, we try to measure the runtime complexity of the program in the sense of whether it's an ONON squared, how it performs on runtime.
